definition: to let nature take its course (idiom)
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly

sentences.english: They just go with the flow.
With things as such , we‘ll have to let things slide.
sentences.chinese: 事到如今，我们也只好顺其自然了。

sentences.english: Traceless is a kind of attitude to life, arbitrary, go with the flow.
sentences.chinese: 无痕是一种生活态度，随心所欲，顺其自然。

sentences.english: But its fantastically successful business model seems to have run its course.
sentences.chinese: 但是富士康非常成功的企业模式似乎都是顺其自然的。

sentences.english: I'll not worry about it. I'll let nature take its course.
sentences.chinese: 我不再为此事发愁了，顺其自然吧。

sentences.english: Invite a few people to seed your page, and then let organic growth take over.
sentences.chinese: 邀请几个朋友去你的个人主页浇花，然后顺其自然。

sentences.english: L-LIYA: Too much should not, always go with the flow occurred.
sentences.chinese: 太多太多的不应该，总是那么顺其自然的发生了。

sentences.english: Everything allows nature to take its course, the senior general demeanor, do not not be able to pass with oneself.
sentences.chinese: 凡事顺其自然，大将风度，不要跟自己过不去。

sentences.english: Sometimes, it’s just fine to let the bad mood ride.
sentences.chinese: 有时，心情不好就顺其自然也很好。

sentences.english: With a little less effort, you could be one of the greats. Ian Plenderleith
sentences.chinese: 少一点努力，顺其自然，你也能成为大师之一。

sentences.english: After that, it all flows naturally.
Pull the troop and let the chips fall as they may.
sentences.chinese: 把部队撤出来，让一切顺其自然。

sentences.english: If you can go with the flow, you’ll find tranquillity.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能顺其自然，你就能找到安宁。

sentences.english: Try for simplicity and if complexity sneaks up on you, so be it.
sentences.chinese: 试着简单，如果复杂靠近你，就顺其自然。

sentences.english: I know that it’s much better — for both of us — to simply let the situation go.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，还是顺其自然比较好。

sentences.english: Do your best and let go.
sentences.chinese: 请你竭尽全力，顺其自然吧。

definition: at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
to insist on/to demand/to impose
to regard as unimportant/to be indifferent to (fame, wealth etc)/(of an economy or a market) to slacken
levelheadedness/calmness/equanimity
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
lit. where water flows, a canal is formed (idiom)/fig. when conditions are right, success will follow naturally
lit. when the boat gets to the pier-head, it will go straight with the current (proverb)/fig. everything will be all right/cf 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: chuan2 dao4 qiao2 tou2 zi4 ran2 zhi2

definition: to let things take their course (idiom)/to leave it to nature/laissez-faire
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself

Since they have come, we should make them comfortable (idiom). Since we're here, take it easy./Since this is so, we should accept it./Now we have come, let's stay and take the rough with the smooth./If you can't do anything to prevent it, you might as well sit back and enjoy it.
pinyin: ji4 lai2 zhi1 , ze2 an1 zhi1

definition: not to become attached to material things, not to pity oneself
pinyin: bu4 yi3 wu4 xi3 , bu4 yi3 ji3 bei1

definition: satisfied with what one has (idiom)
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
everything
take your time/take it easy
